Description: The Rest on the Flight into Egypt; the Virgin and Child seated at centre against a tree, Joseph at r, two putti behind the group, huts at l. 1514 Pen and black ink, heightened with white bodycolour, on greenish-brown prepared paper
Curator's comments: The date 1514 is now very indistinct, particularly the 4, but it can be very clearly seen in the reproduction of this drawing in 'Dürer Society', vii, 1904, pl.xii, in which Dodgson first made the attribution to Springinklee.

Rowlands 1993 LITERATURE: Mayor Collection, p. 51, no. 273; Mayor Collection 1875, p. 100, no. 479; C. Dodgson, Dürer Society, vii, 1904, p. 11, no. xii, repr.; K.T. Parker, OMD, i, 1926, p. 12; BM Guide, 1928, p. 38, no. 328; Manchester, German Art, p. 53, no. 133; Rowlands, Dürer, p. 60, no. 366; BM Dürer and Holbein, p. 139, no. 108, repr. Mayor thought the drawing to be by Albrecht Altdorfer (q.v.) and it was registered as such on entering the Museum. The correct attribution to Springinklee was first made by Dodgson, who pointed out the existence of the date and the monogram. Like the only other signed drawing by Springinklee, the ‘Christ as Man of Sorrows’ in the Kupferstichkabinett, Basel (inv. no. 1959. 110; ‘Meister um Dürer’, pl. 67) 1876,1209.618 reveals the influence of Altdorfer and the Danube School, particularly in the treatment of the landscape.
Bibliographic references: Rowlands 1993 / Drawings by German artists and artists from German-speaking regions of Europe in the Department of Prints and Drawings in the British Museum: the 15thC & 16thC by Artists born before 1530 (468)
Exhibition history: 1928 BM London, Guide Woodcuts, Drawings of A. Dürer, no. 328 1961, Manchester, City Art Gallery, 'German Art', no. 133 1988, July-Oct, BM, Age of Dürer & Holbein, no. 108 1971, BM, Dúrer no.366
